title: How many songs did Sri purandardas create? - Quora

response.answer_text: Shri Purandaradasa is considered Sangeetha Pithamaha of Carnatic Music. Even Saint Thyagaraja has acknowledged his contribution. Though nearly 475000 compositions were said to be created by him, hardly 700 have survived. He has mainly composed in Kannada, his mother tongue and a few in Sanskrit as well. He is revered even by the Hindustani Musicians as Mian Tansen’s Guru, Swamy Haridas, was believed to be a disciple of Shri Purandaradasa. There are umpteen krithis of this great saint, which are household songs, not only in Karnataka, but also in Tamilnadu, from where I hail. It was Smt ML Vasanthakumari, who had popularised the Dasarnamas through her concerts and her mother Smt Lalithangi edited a music book of Dasar Namas. Please enjoy the eternally popular songs like Narayana ( Suddha Dhanyasi ), Jagadhodharana ( Kaapi ) etc from well known artists.

Tradition and legend holds that he composed 475,000 kirtanas. Further, according to this legend, his original desire was to compose 500,000 keerthanas (songs). Being unable to do it in his present life, he requested his younger son to complete them. His son Madhwapathi told his father that he could do this in his next janma(birth). It is believed that he was reborn as the famous Vijayadaasa—birthplace is Cheekalparvi village near Maanvi town, Raichur district in Karnataka State—and completed the remaining 25 thousand keerthanas as promised.
